abstract: News Corporation has made an unsolicited bid for Dow Jones that values the publisher of The Wall Street Journal and Barron’s at about $5 billion. Dow Jones, a 125-year-old company controlled by the Bancroft family, said it is evaluating the offer, which may come either as a cash bid or cash and News Corp. stock.
lead_paragraph: News Corporation has made an unsolicited bid for Dow Jones that values the publisher of The Wall Street Journal and Barron’s at about $5 billion. Dow Jones, a 125-year-old company controlled by the Bancroft family, said it is evaluating the offer, which may come either as a cash bid or cash and News Corp. stock.

headline.main: News Corp. Bids $5 Billion for Dow Jones

abstract: NEW YORK (AP) -- News Corporation, which includes Fox News Channel among its holdings, is offering to buy Dow Jones, publisher of The Wall Street Journal, according to CNBC.
lead_paragraph: NEW YORK (AP) -- News Corporation, which includes Fox News Channel among its holdings, is offering to buy Dow Jones, publisher of The Wall Street Journal, according to CNBC.

headline.main: News Corp. Bidding for Down Jones, CNBC Says

abstract: Shares of several newspaper publishing companies posted big gains after Dow Jones disclosed that it received an unsolicited takeover offer from News Corporation, Rupert Murdoch’s global media empire. Dow Jones said Tuesday it was considering the proposal but warned that a deal might not happen; nevertheless, investors bid up shares of its peers, apparently hoping that they might also become takeover targets.
lead_paragraph: Shares of several newspaper publishing companies posted big gains after Dow Jones disclosed that it received an unsolicited takeover offer from News Corporation, Rupert Murdoch’s global media empire. Dow Jones said Tuesday it was considering the proposal but warned that a deal might not happen; nevertheless, investors bid up shares of its peers, apparently hoping that they might also become takeover targets.

abstract: Rumors that the Bancrofts would sell Dow Jones, the 125-year-old publishing company they control through family trusts, have circulated for years. Usually, they peter out as observers note the family’s loyalty to management and its fealty to the idea that The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones’s flagship publication, is a public trust and not just an asset.
lead_paragraph: Rumors that the Bancrofts would sell Dow Jones, the 125-year-old publishing company they control through family trusts, have circulated for years. Usually, they peter out as observers note the family’s loyalty to management and its fealty to the idea that The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones’s flagship publication, is a public trust and not just an asset.

headline.main: Will $5 Billion Persuade Dow Jones’s Owners to Sell?

abstract: The headline number is eye-catching, but the logic behind Rupert Murdoch’s $5 billion offer for Dow Jones & Company may be even more interesting. Mr. Murdoch’s News Corporation already has an array of broadcasting, film, print and Internet assets. What does he want with Dow Jones, the publisher of The Wall Street Journal?
lead_paragraph: The headline number is eye-catching, but the logic behind Rupert Murdoch’s $5 billion offer for Dow Jones & Company may be even more interesting. Mr. Murdoch’s News Corporation already has an array of broadcasting, film, print and Internet assets. What does he want with Dow Jones, the publisher of The Wall Street Journal?

headline.main: Murdoch’s Bid for Dow Jones: Reading Between the Lines

abstract: The Bancrofts face a difficult decision.
snippet: The Bancrofts face a difficult decision.
lead_paragraph: Rupert Murdoch has left the Bancroft family, which controls Dow Jones, in a difficult position.

headline.main: Will the Bancrofts Take the Money and Run?

abstract: Time for round two in News Corporation‘s quest to win Dow Jones & Company.
lead_paragraph: Time for round two in News Corporation‘s quest to win Dow Jones & Company.

headline.main: Bancroft Family Votes Against News Corp. Offer

abstract: In a bid as high-profile and potentially contentious as News Corporation‘s $5 billion offer for Dow Jones & Company, it’s only natural that the players in the drama would reach for the big guns. And so they have.
lead_paragraph: In a bid as high-profile and potentially contentious as News Corporation‘s $5 billion offer for Dow Jones & Company, it’s only natural that the players in the drama would reach for the big guns. And so they have.

headline.main: Advisers Suit Up for Dow Jones Showdown
